data.title: Added panning support for Music
data.body: Added a setPan function to Music. Works for all backends except for HTML5, which seems to missing quite a lot of audio stuff at the moment.

data.title: AndroidSound#play/loop now returns -1 on failure, to match other backends
data.body:
There is currently an inconsistency in the backends; OpenALSound#play and IOSSound#play both return -1 on failure, while AndroidSound returns 0. This is because of the Android [SoundPool](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/SoundPool.html#play(int, float, float, int, int, float)).
This fix simply modifies AndroidSound to match the other backends.

data.title: draw substring of BitmapFontCache
data.body: Allows for drawing a substring of the cache for letter-by-letter text scrolling. I didn't see any other/better way of accomplishing this than adding this method.

data.title: Partial refactor for Array class
data.body:
I present a partial refactoring of the array class. RemoveAll method has been refactored to avid repeated code and I have added two new removeAll methods to indicate if using identity of equality.

I would like to apply the same refactoring for other method (like contains) as a first step to split the Array class into two new classes: ArrayIdentity and ArrayEquality. I guest is improbably using equality and identity over the same Array object.

Equality<T> interface allows extracting the different code of the removeAll method.

I discovered a bug in Array:removeAll method. If identity is true, then the equals method is used. I have fixed that bug.

I have added docs for a couple of add method.

I have added the generic type <? Extends T> to methods: addAll, Array constructor, removeAll  and ArrayIterator fields.

Finally, I have added a new package structure for test cases with JUnit 4. I have included the test cases used for refactoring Array class.

Regards

data.title: Add support for GID attribute & Issue 1477 Fix
data.body:
So, long story short
https://github.com/bjorn/tiled/issues/91

In Tiled, the y coordinate value is inconsistent between rectangle objects vs tile objects.
For example, set your tile size to 32x32 in tiled.
Add an object layer.
Add a rect to the object layer, position 0,0, width 1, height 1.  It will be in the upper left corner of the map.
Add a tile object from your tileset.  The map starts at 0,1.
I tried building the latest nightly of Tiled from GIT, the issue is still there.  

However, what is the most elegant way to deal with with LibGDX?
x and y are added to the Object properties.  This issue only occurs with Tiled map objects that are "tile" based, where they have an image.  This uses the "gid" attribute in XML for Tiled.
  <object type="com.cookwithkevin.game.enemy.GreenSlime" gid="1025" x="482" y="1330" width="32" height="32"/>

So, a programmer, if gid is exposed, now has a way to deal with this.  They can offset the object up 1 tile.  

This should be a harmless change to support it.  Additionally, this gives the flexibility to assign an image to a Tiled map object based on GID instead of doing something else, if someone wanted to.

If this is inappropriate, setting a property manually on such an object is a workaround, ie, "hasYCoordBug" or something similar.   

The underlying issue is that there's no way to determine once you load a map with TMXMapLoader what is a "rect" and what is a "tile" based object.  This gives a way, if it has a gid, it's a "tile" based object.

data.title: Add skeletontest and various fixes
data.body:
- Add SkeletonTest for easy debugging, see http://youtu.be/8E0gtpBTfA0
- Default texture uv wrap to GL_REPEAT
- Add mtl shininess and opacity
- Fix BlendingAttribute constructor
- Fix MeshBuilder#box when not using normal
- GLES10: Default cullface to GL_BACK
- GLES10: Use GL_QUADRATIC_ATTENUATION for intensity, just like defaultshader
- GLES10: Use glLightModelfv for ambient
- GLES10: Use glMaterialfv when lighting is applied

data.title: Pool Cell objects in Tables
data.body:
I've added a new Pool implementation, SimplePool, and used it to pool Cell objects in BaseTableLayout.

A new ArrayList was added to BaseTableLayout to track cells created for rows and columns.

When clear is called in BaseTableLayout the Cells are returned to the pool.

Cell now implements Poolable so the values, other than layout, can be reset. layout is a final variable and I decided to keep it that way. This means each BaseTableLayout instance has its own SimplePool since the layout can't be changed. Adding a getter and setter for layout to Cell would let us have a static SimplePool for BaseTableLayout which might be a little more memory efficient.

Hope it's useful. Cheers :)

data.title: ImageTextButtonStyle: Do not set fields twice and add constructor
data.body:
The constructor can be used to conveniently reuse TextButton styles and adding custom images.
All fields that are added by ImageTextButtonStyle are optional, so this new constructor does not break any required fields by leaving them blank.

data.title: Atlas builder Ant Task with improvements
data.body: Hi, this pull request adds an Ant Task for the Atlas Builder with the following features ; - Ant Task - define sprites from a bigger images (i.e. one source file can contain more than one sprite) with different resolution support (i.e. scaling coordinates), - include font in atlas - extends font with custom sprite - specify hot points for sprites - use different padding for sprites of the same atlas - use custom filtering durring generation (for hover effect, preparing for linear filtering,...) - merging of last pages of differents packs Here is an example of an ant file using it ; `````` XML ``` ``````

data.title: Minor improvements to classom.badlogic.gdx.utils. Array<T>
data.body:
Changes to class com.badlogic.gdx.utils. Array<T>

1) ArrayIterator attribute now has the generic type T.
2) add, addAlland removeAll methods now accepts Array objects of type T or types derived from type T.
3) Generic type added in the creation of the iterator in the iterator() method.
4) Class ArrayIterable seems to have no utility. It has been deleted.
5) Documentation has been added to methods add and addAll.

Regards.

Signed-off-by: Javier J. javierj@us.es

data.title: Add ship.obj and shadertest
data.body:
Added ship.obj (from gdx-invaders) to the tests.
Added ShaderTest to show how:
- To create and use your own Material.Attribute
- To create your own shader without using DefaultShader
- To use BaseShaderProvider to provide your own shader

data.title: Add alphaTest, Keep bind transforms with bones, and other changes
data.body:
See also: https://github.com/libgdx/fbx-conv/pull/14

Also fixed ObjLoader (only diffuse textures like previous), removed textureDir so it functions the same as G3dLoader.
Made ModelLoader easier to use without AssetManager (public loadModelData and public loadModel).

data.title: Move materialtest to g3d tests, update it to show opacity.
fixed diffuse color and specular lighting in DefaultShader
Snapvalues for Slider
data.body: The PR should be pretty much self explaining. I had to make the slider snap to some specific values (0, 30, 45, 60 and 90 in my case) and figuered others might have use for this as well. It will snap to a given value, if the slider knob is within the threshold value.

data.title: Make it easier to specify a shader, add Material IntAttribute, face culling, opacity and shininess
Remove non working test models, add Basic3DTest, rename ModelTest
data.body:
Remove old test models, add new head and teapot model
Rename NewModelTest to ModelTest.
Add Basic3DTest to show a very basic use case.
Remove debug logging
Add async loading to the tests (loading the head takes very long)

data.title: Address some lifecycle issues with LwjglAWTCanvas
data.body: LwjglAWTCanvas has some lifecycle issues. This addresses some of them.

data.title: Add support for 0-alpha pixel to TexturePacker2
data.body:
The current implementation uses Graphics2d to render image when creating atlas texture.
Graphics2d will not preserve the color of pixel with 0 alpha. This can be seen when  scaling down the texture with linear filtering ; blending will be performed using black pixels for the 0 alpha pixel instead of the initial color.

This modification use direct ARGB copy to preserve color when alpha is 0, leading to correct filtering.

I performed some testing comparing results between the current implementation and this one, not finding unexpected changes. There are some situations where the current implementation will behave "strangely" (at least, I don't fully understand), like using rotation, different padding on X and Y axis with non even padding, all of this in the same time. Not sure of the use case of this type of situation ; anyway, the result with this implementation should be satisfying as well.

I have read the sticky post from the forum (http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=635) and I think this is different.  
This change will only help if you produce sprite with color over fully transparent area (like in this post : http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=635&p=27934)

Edit : sorry, I made it wrong with git. Please use ?w=1 to have a readable pull ; https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/414/files?w=1

data.title: New3dapi: Add (binary) json
data.body:
This adds a (premature) binary json reader. See https://github.com/libgdx/fbx-conv/pull/6
Also merged master

data.title: Fixed issue 1449
data.body: Fixing https://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1449

data.title: GWT Preloader + Cleanup + Reflection
data.body:
Improved GWT preloader with continuous byte progress and audio preloading. Cleaned up code to use XmlHttpRequest 2 binary downloads.
- Create a new class AssetLoader that implements all type of asset loading
- Directly download binary content through XHR2 ArrayBuffer (instead of String + overrided mime type)
- Refactored progress report to use a global preloader state with continuous download progress (based on byte progress / total byte size)

Add capability to extend GWT reflection system with module configuration property.
- define 2 simple properties to include or exclude classes from reflection system

data.title: added Pixmap#fillTriangle
data.body:
Please consider merging this implementation of fillTriangle(). I want to be able to compose arbitrary filled polygons quickly within a pixmap,

See http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1448

-james

data.title: Add font name to hiero settings file
data.body:
When loading my Hiero font settings, the font name was not stored.
Re-generating the font atlas obviously resulted in the wrong font atlas. (it was a while ago when I lastly generated the atlas).

This can be prevented by storing the font name in the settings file as well, which is done by this commit.

data.title: Added some extra OUYA mappings
data.body:
I'm currently trying out the controller API for the OUYA, noticed i missed some mappings.
Added these. 
I'm also looking into working with multi-controller, nothing done yet.
